org.ptolemy.ptango.lib

Class WebApplicationInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ptolemy.ptango.lib.WebApplicationInfo

  • public class WebApplicationInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Information for a web application running on a web server. Used by WebServerUtilities
    Since:
    Ptolemy II 10.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Elizabeth Latronico and Edward A. Lee
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (ltrnc)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (ltrnc)

      • WebApplicationInfo

        public WebApplicationInfo(java.lang.String modelName,
                          java.lang.String applicationPath,
                          FileParameter temporaryFileLocation)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Construct a new instance of this class with the given model name, an application path, and a temporary file location.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The full name of the model
        applicationPath - The base path for the application
        temporaryFileLocation - The directory where temporary files are stored
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the model does not yet have a name (for example, a new unsaved model)

    • Method Detail

      • addServletInfo

        public void addServletInfo(java.net.URI path,
                           javax.servlet.Servlet servlet)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Add a new servlet path to the set of paths of this web application. Null, empty or duplicate paths are not allowed. Return true if the path was added successfully, or false if the path was null, empty or a duplicate
        Parameters:
        path - The new servlet path to add
        servlet - The servlet to associated with the servlet path
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the path has already been requested by another servlet

      • addSocketInfo

        public void addSocketInfo(java.net.URI path,
                          Entity entity)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Add a new socket path to the set of paths of this web application. Null or empty paths are not allowed. New path is not allowed if already claimed by a servlet or resource. Return true if the path was added successfully; false otherwise
        Parameters:
        path - The new socket path to add
        entity - The entity (multiple allowed) associated with this socket path
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the path has already been requested by a servlet or resource

      • addResourceInfo

        public void addResourceInfo(java.net.URI path,
                            java.util.Set<org.eclipse.jetty.util.resource.Resource> resourceLocations)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Add a new resource path and location set for this web application. A null path is not allowed. An empty path is OK (since apps may share a resource handler, it can make sense to map the handler to the root path). If the path is a duplicate of a path already assigned to a resource handler, the resource location list for that path will be updated. The path may not be a duplicate of a path already assigned to a context handler. There should be at least one resource location.
        Parameters:
        path - The new resource path to add. May not be null.
        resourceLocations - The non-empty set of resource locations to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If this path is a duplicate of a path already requested by a servlet, or if the resource does not exist

      • getTemporaryFileLocation

        public FileParameter getTemporaryFileLocation()
        Get the location where temporary files should be stored. May be empty or null if the web application does not use temporary files.
        Returns:
        The location where temporary files should be stored. May be empty or null if the web application does not use temporary files
        See Also:
        setTemporaryFileLocation(FileParameter)

      • hasPath

        public boolean hasPath(java.lang.String path)
        Returns true if the web application has already mapped a handler to the given URL; returns false otherwise. The handler can be any handler - for example, a ContextHandler or a ResourceHandler. This check is purposefully NOT case-sensitive. While URLs are case-sensitive (excluding the domain name), many users are not aware of this, and it would be confusing to have two URLs that differ only in case. The application path should be included as part of this URL, e.g. /webapp/start for service /start of application /webapp
        Parameters:
        path - The URL to check for existing mappings
        Returns:
        True if the web application has already mapped a handler to the given URL; false otherwise

      • hasPath

        public boolean hasPath(java.net.URI path)
        Returns true if the web application has already mapped a handler to the given URL; returns false otherwise. See hasPath(String path)
        Parameters:
        path - The URL to check for existing mappings
        Returns:
        True if the web application has already mapped a handler to the given URL; false otherwise

      • hasResourcePath

        public boolean hasResourcePath(java.lang.String path)
        Returns true if the web application has already mapped a resource handler to the given path. Used by the web server to determine if a new resource handler is needed or if an existing one can be re-used.
        Parameters:
        path - The URL to check for existing mappings to a resource handler
        Returns:
        True if the web application has already mapped a resource handler to the given URL

        Parameters:

        See Also:
